parameters: <WordWrap>Ever wanted to display the gold window and leave it on the map screen for a bit? This plugin will allow you to do that with just a few plugin commands.
<WordWrap>I wonder if I can set a record for the number of books read in a single day?
<WordWrap>Would you like to alter the \c[4]Map Gold Window\c[0]?
<WordWrap>How would you like to reposition it?
<WordWrap>This plugin will allow you to alter the battlebacks used by default for the overworld in addition to bind specific battlebacks to specific tiles on the map through usage of regions.
<WordWrap>Apply common events to specified regions! Simply by stepping on a tile marked by that region will trigger a specific common event!
<WordWrap>\>What \c[4]Region Restrictions Plugin\c[0] do you want to learn about?
<WordWrap>Dont like having NPCs wandering into places they dont belong? Feel like the player shouldnt have access to certain parts of the map?
<WordWrap>The \c[4]Region Restrictions\c[0] plugin lets you do just that by simply planting regions onto the map to prevent those nosy events from going to places they shouldnt.
<WordWrap>This plugin expands region restrictions (and allowed regions) to vehicles. On top of that, you can designate specific regions for vehicles to land in.

<WordWrap>This way, you can make it so that small boats cannot traverse certain bodies of watever, land in only certain spots, etc. that ships can or vice versa! Add a bit more variety to the way vehicles are handled for your game!
<WordWrap>NPCs often reset their map locations when a player reenters a map. However, you can change that using this plugin by having the game save their event locations!
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<

<WordWrap>This plugin enables you to set which tiles are slippery tiles through either regions or notetags. To use regions, change the parameter setting to which region ID you would like to associate with a slippery tile.
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
<WordWrap>This plugin helps faciliate eventing a \c[4]Jump\c[0] system for your \c[4]RPG Maker\c[0] game by introducing \c[4]Smart Jumps\c[0].

<WordWrap>\c[4]Smart Jumps\c[0] will allow you to jump over areas, but will limit you from jumping on top of places you cant go, on top of normal priority events, and set up boundaries (such as walls) that you normally cannot jump past.
<WordWrap>In this sample project, you can access the \c[4]Smart Jump\c[0] action by pressing the C button assuming that the Keyboard Configuration hasn't been changed.
<WordWrap>A feature that was removed from \c[4]RPG Maker 2000\c[0] and \c[4]RPG Maker 2003\c[0] was the \c[4]Stop Event Movement\c[0] event.
<WordWrap>This event prevented events from automatically moving by themselves, so they dont intrude on cutscenes, catch up to the player during messages, etc.
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to have an enemy be a basic randomizing swap dummy for other enemies.
<WordWrap>Insert enemy IDs of other enemies inside of the swap notetag and those enemies will take place of the swap monster at the start of a battle.
<WordWrap>\>What \c[4]Event Chase Player Plugin\c[0] do you want to learn about?
<WordWrap>Events have a typically bland movement behavior. They either stand in one place, always chase you, always run from you, move randomly, or always just move in specified patterns.
<WordWrap>This plugin lets your events suddenly switch from their norm to chasing or fleeing from the player.
<WordWrap>This extension plugin grants your player the ability to go Stealth Mode for either a limited set amount of time or an unlimited amount of time.
<WordWrap>While in \c[4]Stealth Mode\c[0], the player will not alert any events set by the \c[4]Event Chase Player\c[0] plugin.
<WordWrap>This plugin also includes region areas that are considered stealth regions.
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<

<WordWrap>For those who have on-screen encounters, you may have discovered that making touch encounters in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] to be rather difficult when it comes to performing a sneak attack upon an event or such.
<WordWrap>This plugin makes the event encounter checking process easier by providing six conditional script calls for you to utilize when checking event vs player positions.
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
I play video games, not because I have no life,
but so I can experience many.
You have to dream before your dreams can come true.
Real friends don't get offended when you insult them.
They smile and call you something even more offensive.
<WordWrap>\c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] provides us with 15 \c[4]Balloon Animations\c[0] to use have to allow our events to show emotions with. Sometimes, this just isn't enough.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to use icons from your \c[4]IconSet\c[0] to extend the number of balloon types you can use.
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
<WordWrap>For those using custom fonts, you may have noticed that not all fonts from the /fonts/ directory are loaded at the time the game is loaded.
<WordWrap>This plugin let's you place the fonts into the \c[4]/fonts/\c[0] directory and then load them as the game starts.
<WordWrap>\fn<CC Wild Words>Using the \c[4]Message Core\c[0] plugin, you can then change the font to whatever you like. This is \c[4]CC Wild Words\c[0]. It looks like a comic book font.
<WordWrap>\fn<DS Pixel Cyr>This is \c[4]DS Pixel Cyr\c[0]. This one is very pixelated and can be used for retro games.
<WordWrap>Fonts can be used in a variety of ways to bring life to your game so make use of them if you can!
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<

<WordWrap>\c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0] comes with \c[4]Self Switch\c[0] functionality. However, the number of \c[4]Self Switches\c[0] provided is a mere 4 in total, not enough for some of the more complex events.
<WordWrap>This plugin will let you extend the number of \c[4]Self Switches\c[0].
<WordWrap>\c[4]Self Variables\c[0], on the other hand, do not exist in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0], so this plugin will provide functionality for that as well.
A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
<WordWrap>In \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0], tilesets are used for mapping purposes. \c[4]Tileset A\c[0] is used for drawing land while \c[4]Tilesets B\c[0] through \c[4]E\c[0] are used to add doodads.
<WordWrap>But in \c[4]RPG Maker MV\c[0], doodads added by \c[4]Tilesets B\c[0] through \c[4]E\c[0] are locked to the grid and add a rather unnatural feel to it.
<WordWrap>This plugin will allow you to break free of the grid and add doodads unbound by the grid. Doodads can come in all forms, from large to small, static and animated, you name it!
\>Would you like to visit this crystal's \c[8]Closed Space\c[0]?\<
<WordWrap>In RPG Maker MV, you can either choose to enable encounters or disable them completely.
<WordWrap>However, making a system that repels encounters for a certain amount of steps or increase the encounter rate for a certain amount of steps is a whole different matter.
<WordWrap>This plugin allows you to create ways to repel encounters, generate lures, and the rate at which lures are done.
"The calm glow of the full moon, basking us
"It's on nights like these... that I feel truly ali-"
Oh, hello there. Name's Skunk. I'm just proofreading
a book that I've been working on.
It's called "Lydia Story". This right here is book two of three,
"Lydia and the Forest". It's based on the story of how
Lydia VanVoder and I crossed paths and became friends.
I could tell you all about it, but then there wouldn't be
much point to me writing this, would there? I think it'll
be more exciting to experience it for yourself.
I've been enjoying my time in this town. I usually prefer more
tranquil places like forests, but sometimes it gets boring and
Though, it always gets too exciting, a big crazy place
like this full of people. So I came to this library to wind
down, do a little reading, and work on my story.
Not that I mind the company. Feel free to lounge
around here if you like, don't let me bother you.
I really appreciate you listening to all of my rambling.
It's nice to talk to people, and I get excited about my work.
Several other people from back home are in town right now.
Lydia, Lars, Lyle, Dragon, Platypus, even Solar and Polar are
here. I bet they'd all love to meet you too.
